jm.util

Class AbstractReadButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Button
        • jm.util.AbstractReadButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public abstract class AbstractReadButton
extends java.awt.Button
    A abstract button class which handles reading of MIDI and jMusic files. This is designed for user interfaces. If exceptions occur a dialog box is created and displayed detailing the problem. If you want the errors to be transparent to your user, or you want to manage exception-handling try using the Read class instead.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • readFile

        public Score readFile(java.lang.String directoryName,
             java.lang.String fileName)
        Checks to see whether the file specified is a valid JM or MIDI and if so returns its data as a Score. If an error is encountered a dialog box is displayed describing the error, and the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - String describing the directory structure of the file to be read
        fileName - String describing the full name of the file to be read
        Returns:
        Score describing the music data in the file, or null if an error was encountered.
